title: Understanding OCPD
text: Obsessive-compulsive personality disorder (OCPD) is not the same as obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). OCPD is more about personality traits rather than specific compulsions or obsessions.

title: Key Characteristics of OCPD
text: OCPD is characterized by a focus on orderliness, perfectionism, and control. These traits can interfere with a person's ability to complete tasks efficiently.

hintAnswer: a pervasive pattern of preoccupation with orderliness, perfectionism, and control
title: Identifying the Correct Pattern
text: Which of the following best describes the pattern associated with OCPD?
choices: an inflated sense of $$self-importance$$, a constant need for admiration and attention, and a lack of empathy for others
a pervasive pattern of social inhibition, feelings of inadequacy, and hypersensitivity to criticism or rejection
a pervasive and excessive need to be taken care of by others
a pervasive pattern of preoccupation with orderliness, perfectionism, and control
